435: About NYC Health + Hospitals NYC Health + Hospitals/Metropolitan is the community hospital of choice for residents of East Harlem, northern Manhattan, and neighboring communities. The hospital provides culturally-sensitive care in a welcoming and hospitable setting, emphasizing primary care medicine and utilizing the latest advances in medical science. Metropolitan delivers high quality health services with compassion, dignity, and respect to all, without exception. Since its founding in 1875, the hospital has been affiliated with New York Medical College, representing the oldest partnership between a hospital and a private medical school in the United States. Metropolitan is a part of the NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest municipal hospital and health care system in the country. At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons. Job Description SUMMARY OF DUTIES: Under supervision, sort, racks, and accessions specimens into the laboratory computer system. Performs specimen preparation, centrifuges, decanting, and other task related to specimen processing. MAJOR DUTIES: 1. Handles laboratory specimens including blood, urines, and body fluids. 2. Sorts, racks, and accessions specimens for distribution to MHC Stat, & Northwell + Labs 3. Centrifuges and decants specimens and performs necessary preparation, freezing, and/or transferring plasma/serum/urine into appropriate specimen containers. 4. Picks up specimens from designated blood drawing areas and delivers specimens to the appropriate labs when necessary. 5. Address telephone inquiries concerning laboratory specimen information status. 6. Retrieves information from a computer system. 7. Maintains inventory of laboratory supplies. 8. Maintains laboratory records, ex: Batch Repot1s, Lab Slips, & DOH. 9. Cleans and maintains workstations at the beginning of the shift and the end of the shift. SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE Specimen Processing Techniques 1. Windows XP familiar 2. Specimen types identification and sorting of the same 3. Cerner Computer functions (Specimen log-in, transfer orders to reference labs, order inquiry, etc.) 4. Reading thermometer temperatures on refrigerator/incubator and recording on charts. 5. Identifying records for storing and labeling destroy dates. 6. Specimen preparation: centrifuging, aliquoting, and freezing procedures. 7. Interact and collaborate with co-workers in relation to specimen processing. 8. Answer telephone inquiries and ability to resolve problems with specimen tracking. 9. Able to send a fax as needed. 10. Knowledge of the location of clinics and ward areas for retrieval and delivery of specimens when necessary. 11. Knowledge of the functioning of the centrifuge and refrigerated centrifuge. Minimum Qualifications 1. Graduation from a Senior High School or High School Equivalency Diploma and one year of experience in a laboratory environment performing related work as described in position; or, 2. Satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and experience. How To Apply Please be advised that proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required prior to hire.
